cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles W of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, then expected to emerge over the north-western Caribbean, cross the Yucatan Channel and track north-north-westward toward the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Plaquemines Parish / southeast Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline at this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coastline from southeast Louisiana eastward across Mississippi, Alabama and the Florida Panhandle lies within forecast cone
weather_observation.wind: Cumulative 34-kt wind chance 34% with peak 24% onset probability around 96 h; 14% chance of 50-kt winds — hurricane (Category 1) strength possible at landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for greater than 3 ft inundation along the Plaquemines Parish coast if Nate becomes a hurricane and makes landfall nearby.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches possible along southeast Louisiana with localized higher totals, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas, dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of the system; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain-bands during approach.
